Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Level contains a representation of a level for a game of pacman. A method for parsing a level from a text file is provided. The file must contain the appropriate characters for the level. 'x' represents walls, '.' represents pellets, 'p' represents pacman, 'c' represents cherries, and 'g' represents the ghost spawn point - a sample level file is show in level.txt The Level shows what the game level looks like when created, but it will not be updated during play.It contains information on the locations of the walls, the origin point of pacman, the ghost spawn, and the locations of all the pellets and cherries when the level begins.

      Level(char[][] tiles)
      Constructs a level based off of the specified 2D char array

    • Method Detail

      • isValidLocation

        public boolean isValidLocation(Location location)
        Determines whether the given location is a valid location in the level. A location is valid if it falls within the bounds of the level and is not a wall.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to be checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the location is valid

      • wrapLocation

        public Location wrapLocation(Location location)
        If the given location is out of bounds of the level, this wraps the location around. If the location goes off the board at the top, it will me moved to the same column, but at the bottom. If the location does not go off the board, nothing changes
        Parameters:
        location - the location that might need to be wrapped
        Returns:
        the location after it has been wrapped around the board

      • getPelletLocations

        public Location[] getPelletLocations()

      • getCherryLocations

        public Location[] getCherryLocations()
        Returns an array of the initial locations of each cherry on the level
        Returns:
        the initial locations of all the cherries on the level

      • parseLevel

        public static char[][] parseLevel(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns the 2D char array that represents the level contained in the specified file. Each row of the file corresponds to a row of the level. All levels are assumed to be rectangular (your file does not contain a rectangluar level, ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exceptions will occur in the level created from this 2D array)
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file containing the level
        Returns:
        the 2D char array representing the level
